medical_history.chief_complaint: Severe combined immunodeficiency (SCID) identified at birth through screening.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The infant was screened at birth, revealing profound T-cell lymphopenia and no detectable T-cell receptor excision circles (TRECs). Symptoms are associated with developmental abnormalities including neonatal teeth, hypotonia, umbilical hernia, and erythamatous psoriaform dermatitis, which were responsive to treatment. Imaging revealed craniofacial abnormalities and absence of corpus callosum. Immunologic studies indicated a Tâˆ’B+NK+ phenotype.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The infant has a de novo missense mutation in BCL11B, leading to 'leaky' SCID and associated multisystem anomalies.
medical_history.family_history: The parents are non-consanguineous and healthy, with no known family history of immune deficiency.
